metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6887 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenJPEG 1.5.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors that trigger NULL pointer dereferences, division-by-zero, and other errors. ebarretto> Only affects 1.5.1

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjpeg-java - 1.5.2-2
libopenjpeg5 - 1.5.2-2
openjpeg-tools - 1.5.2-2
openjpip-dec-server - 1.5.2-2
openjpip-server - 1.5.2-2
openjpip-viewer - 1.5.2-2
openjpip-viewer-xerces - 1.5.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-2').
